questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 Sales consultant.
A customer asks you to create a main form for contacts. The form must include the following information:
✑ account name and phone number
✑ related opportunities
✑ notes and activities
You need to configure the form.
Which options should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate options to the correct information. Each option may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is:
Quick View Form (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/maker/model-driven-apps/quick-view-control-properties-legacy)
Subgrid - You will add a list view on the form for related opportunities

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Sales.
The solution must support a new standardized sales process. The process must be the same for both new and existing customers.
✑ Sales representatives must follow up on email inquiries about products within 24 hours.
✑ The time it takes for sales representatives to follow up on inquiries must be reportable.
All quotes for new customers must be reviewed and approved by the sales manager for specific criteria.
//IMG//

You need to configure playbooks to meet the requirements.
What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
You manage Dynamics 365 Sales. You have a sales territory named SalesTerritoryA, which has an associated manager.
You need to create a new sales territory named SalesTerritoryB and assign the SalesTerritoryA manager to SalesTerritoryB.
Which four actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
NOTE: More than one order of answer choices is correct. You will receive credit for any of the correct orders you select.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
The given answer is in the correct order.
It could be also Create a new territory, replace the manager for sales Territory A, associate the replaced manager to salse territory B, and add members. 
The trick is one manager can't be associated with two territories.
Correct!!
b/e/d/a corretto
b/e/d/a correct

Changing the name of the territory is garbage.
You can only associate the manager with Sales Territory B AFTER he has been removed from A
So as long as Replace the Manager from SalesTerritoryA with another manager comes before Associate the manager from SalesTerritoryA, and create the new territory comes before Add Members and Associate the manager from SalesTerritoryA, pretty much any order will work
in exam
As given in the question, create new sales territory, then it will be sales territory B:

Is this right?in the answer ,there is not SalesTerritoryB.
anyone can help me?
thanks.

comments.content: You create a new territory, which will be this SalesTerritoryB.

choices.D: Ensure that the prefix setting is read-only
choices.B: Reduce the auto number prefix to one character
choices.A: Change the field type from auto number to decimal number
choices.C: Reduce the suffix length to four characters

discussion.content: Hi B should be the right one. Because the question is about quotes. If i change the suffix it will apply to all records like cases etc. If i change prefix, it applies only to selected record.

Changing the suffix length applies to all auto-numbered entities - just tried it. If you change suffix from 6 to 4 then this applies to Cases, Quotes, Orders, the lot.This is of course what you might want. Changing the prefix only changes the letters for the entity concerned (as they are all different). The offline/online issue is a bit of a red herring: the suffix is applied whether online or offline but is simply there to assure AutoNumber uniqueness in the event that two new records (one of them offline) try to pull the same next number from the sequence.

Selected Answer: B
The reason it's only option B not both B and C is because option C would affect the auto-numbering for all entities, whereas the question specifically pertains for only one specific entity.

Selected Answer: B
corretto

Selected Answer: B
correct
b correct

Though B and C both results in reducing the length by two characters, changing Prefix only impacts that entity where as changing suffix impacts all entities and this is not mentioned as an ask in the question. Hence the answer needs to Prefix
Reduce the prefix to one character, will be answered(B), as if we reduce suffix length it automatically apply to all entities(Lead, Opportunity etc.)

I would go with B since it says the minimum possible length. The prefix can be shortened to one character but the suffix can be shortened to 4 numbers. So, the prefix will give us the minimum possible length.

Answer B is correct because there if you change the suffix, it would be applicable to all the record types but prefix will not change for all record types so prefix can be changed. So please lock answer B :)

In the event that you have more than 9999 quotes, which is possible in some organisations, then the suffix would have to be more than 4. Therefore reducing the prefix seems the sensible answer. So when I sit the exam soon, and if it comes up, I will choose "B" reduce the prefix
The answer is specifically stating the auto number prefix which cannot be changed, not the prefix as text, thus in my opinion the answer should be C.

comments.content: Pls ignore my comment. I read the question wrong.

discussion.content:
Settings > Administration > Auto-Numbering - Quote
Here only TWO things you can change.
Prefix -- text field -- which is max 3 char
Suffix -- drop down -- 4, 5 & 6 chars
if You reduce prefix to 1 char - you can reduce at most 2 Characters
if you reduce suffix to 4 - you can reduce at most 2 Characters

So, both the answers B & C are technically correct and equivalent.
BUT -- if you go by sensible mind -- you should choose C -- set the suffic to 4 char
Because, suffix is a random alpha numeric number
Answer is C

comments.content: You can change the prefix (I reduced the QUO prefix to Q) - have you even tested this out in the solution?

discussion.content: Settings > Administration > Auto-Numbering - Quote. Answer is C. You can't change prefix for Quote number.
B correct answer

Both B and C can be solution. Prefix is max 3 characters and suffix is max 6 characters. So ideally both B and C results in reducing 2 characters .. But between 2 B is more preferred option as for C if you reduce suffix to 4 characters you will loose unique reference number after 9999 quotes where as Choosing B will allow you to generate unique numbers till 999999 quotes Refer https://neilparkhurst.com/2019/02/25/mb-210-microsoft-dynamics-365-for-sales-auto-numbering/

comments.content: The question does not ask for the complexity of the quote ID, only to shorten it. Ideally you don't want to reduce the suffix because as Shine commented above, the prefix is fixed so to maximise allowing the system to cater for the most number of quote records is to reduce the fixed component and keep the suffix as is (more permutations and combinations available with the suffix length at 6)

discussion.content: The correct answer is C. Technically, both B and C will reduce the quote number to 14 characters. However, if we reduce the suffix length to four characters, the customer will have to remember only the last 4 characters. The first 10 characters are same on all the quotes.
The correct answer is C. you cannot change the autonumbering. You can change only prefix and suffix length.

Answer is B. Why B? As per the question shortern quite number t the minimum possible length. We can reduce the prefix or suffix length. But, as per the answers B has prefix to one character(Minimum) and C has suffic lenght to four(Maximum). So my view is to go with B.

Option B & C are the tricky one.
 B. Reduce the auto number prefix to one character -> its about auto number which is correct
C. Reduce the suffix length to four characters -> no context given here so it seems not correct.

Therefore, B is the correct answer.
B and C both are correct because the end result will end up having the quote length with same number of characters i.e. 11

In this blog, step 5 says that suffix is only used when you're working offline. So 
 I believe B is correct. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/change-auto-number-prefix-contract-case-article-quote-order-invoice-campaign-category-knowledge-articles

comments.content: but it still uses 6 chars in the suffix, whether it's online or offline.

discussion.content:
B&C sounds correct but If you have to choose only one option than B as 
The suffix is used for records that were created while you were offline.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/change-auto-number-prefix-contract-case-article-quote-order-invoice-campaign-category-knowledge-articles

I believe B was chosen because you can't say for sure you will not get over 9999 quotes, so shortening the prefix is a safer option.

But I agree, B or C could be correct.

It could be B or C. The option allows you to configure a prefix of between 1-3 characters and a suffix of between 4-6 characters. Both are enabled by default and cannot be disabled. I believe that the real question would have been "Which 2 of the following...". So long as you know that I believe that you'll be fine.

comments.content: B cause: " The suffix is used for records that were created while you were offline and for which the number can’t be guaranteed to be unique." _ https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/change-auto-number-prefix-contract-case-article-quote-order-invoice-campaign-category-knowledge-articles

discussion.content: I thing that, !C. Reduce the suffix length to four characters" is the correct answer.

comments.content: Reducing the prefix to 1 or Suffix to 4 is same (2 chars reduction), so B can also be the correct ans. However, if it's matter of reducing size, better remove from Suffix, changing prefix may cause inconsistencies.

questions.question_text:
You work for a company using Dynamics 365 for Sales.
When customers call the company, they must provide their quote number. Customers report that quote numbers are too long.
You need to shorten quote numbers to the minimum possible length.
What should you do?

Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You use business process flows for all Dynamics 365 opportunities.
Some opportunities are closed before business process flow durations are calculated.
You need to ensure that business process flow duration values are calculated.
Solution: At any stage in the business process flow prior to the final stage, select Finish.
Does the solution meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - No

Selected Answer: B
corretto

Selected Answer: B
correct
The answer is B as you will not get the finish button at any stage except in the final stage of the BPF

Selected Answer: B
cspx97 is right. The Finish button is only available in the final step! At any stage, you should select Abandon to meet the goal! The answer is B.
In exam, Jun-22

Selected Answer: B
When pressed Finish, it will calculate the duration for the opportunity. And it will be only available when Close stage is active. So Answer is No.
B. Finish button is only available in the final stage
